Series.Overview: Rocko, ein Wallaby (kleines KÃ¤nguruh) hat die heimatlichen Gefilde der australischen Steppen verlassen, um nach Amerika in die GroÃŸstadt zu ziehen. Genauer gesagt nach O-Town. Dort lebt er sein Junggesellenleben mit seinem Hund Spunky, seinem Nachbarn Ed Bighead, der ihn nicht leiden kann, mit seinen Freunden Heffer und Filburt und einigen anderen mehr oder weniger seltsamen Zeitgenossen. Rocko arbeitet in einem Comic-Laden, hÃ¤ngt mit seinen beiden Freunden herum und genieÃŸt sein Leben (mehr oder weniger). Klingt ganz normal. Nicht jedoch, wenn man Rocko heiÃŸt, tÃ¤glich mit den TÃ¼cken des Alltags wie Einkaufen, der MÃ¼llabfuhr oder einem Nachbarn wie Ed Bighead zu kÃ¤mpfen hat - eine durch und durch schrÃ¤ge Zeichentrickserie.

Episode.Overview: "Trash-O-Madness" was originally animated and produced in 1992 at Joe Murray Studios in Saratoga, California. Half of the pilot was animated by Rocko creator Joe Murray himself, and the rest by his very talented team of animators and assistants.
Deleted scene from the episode "Road Rash"
"Wacky Delly" Live 2012 with Joe Murray and the cast.
Aired as an April Fools Joke on "The 90s are all that"

Episode.Overview: Rocko gets his very own credit card, and Heffer convinces him to go on a spending spree at the mall.
Episode.Writer: |Vince Calandra|Martin Olsen|Jeff Myers|Kevin O'Brien|Roger Chiasson|Don Spencer|

Episode.Overview:

Episode.Overview: When Heffer is forced out of his parents' house, he decides to come and live with Rocko. Eventually, though, the two roommates' very different lifestyles start to conflict with each other.
Episode.Writer: |Vince Calandra|Nick Jennings|George Maestri|Mr. Lawrence|Robert McNally-Scull|Stephen Hillenburg|Jeff Swampy Marsh|

Episode.Overview:
Ein Flug mit Schrecken FÃ¼r einmal muÃŸ Rocko Heffer helfen, und zwar um seine Flugangst zu Ã¼berwinden. Aber nichts kann Heffer und Rocko auf einen Flug mit "Alteisen-Airlines" vorbereiten. Episode.Overview: Rocko tries to get an extremely reluctant Spunky to take a bath. Meanwhile, a situation comedy - starring two microscopic parasites - plays out on Spunky's fur.
Episode.Writer: |Vince Calandra|Martin Olsen|Stephen Hillenburg|Mark O'Hare|Mr. Lawrence|Dan Povenmire|

Episode.Overview:

Episode.Overview: When Rocko gets puuled over by the police because his gas cap is missing, his car gets into the pound and he has to go through driving school all over again, where Rocko is repeatedly warned not to have ""the fat guy"" as an instructor.
Episode.Writer: |Vince Calandra|Martin Olsen|Stephen Hillenburg|Mark O'Hare|Jeff Swampy Marsh|Mr. Lawrence|Robert McNally-Scull|

Episode.Overview: One day, while dining at the local fast-food joint, Heffer accidentally chokes on a chicken ribcage. During his lapse of consciousness thereafter, Heffer has a ""near-death experience.""
Episode.Writer: |George Maestri|Martin Olsen|Stephen Hillenburg|Mark O'Hare|Biff Lawrence|Simon Scull|

Episode.Overview: Rocko scrambles to gather up his trash and put it out, since he's missed garbage day for the past few months. Not to make things any easier, the local mad dog, Earl, is on the loose - and he seems intent on destroying both Rocko's trash AND Rocko.
Episode.Writer: |George Maestri|Joe Murray|Jeff Swampy Marsh|Dan Povenmire|Timothy Berglund|Jeff Myers|

Episode.Overview:

Episode.Overview: Rocko would love to be able to go to a drive-in movie, but it looks like he'll have to settle for the huge matinee complex at the mall. He and Heffer go there, and experience first-hand the ""modern movie-going experience"".
Episode.Writer: |Vince Calandra|Martin Olsen|Timothy Berglund|Jeff Myers|Jeff Swampy Marsh|Dan Povenmire|

Episode.Overview: Rocko gets fired from his job at a huge Comic Book emporium, and subsequently sets out to seek other avenues of employment. He eventually lands a job at Conglom-O, where Ed Bighead is eager to place him in a dangerous occupation - as a product tester.

Episode.Overview: Rocko and Spunky take a trip to the beach, in order to avoid a day of brutal heat.

Episode.Overview:

Episode.Overview: Filburt cons Rocko into being his patient for a big dentristry exam he has to take.
Episode.Writer: |George Maestri|Joe Murray|Vince Calandra|Martin Olsen|Stephen Hillenburg|Mark O'Hare|Mr. Lawrence|Robert McNally-Scull|

Episode.Overview: Rocko becomes sick with the flu, and if he doesn't get better soon, he'll miss the chance to go to the big WWWWF wrestling show.

Episode.Overview: Rocko tries to get over his crush on his beautiful next-door-neighbor, Melba. Heffer tries to help by setting Rocko up with an assortment of dates (via personals ads), but each and every one of them ends in disaster.
Episode.Writer: |Vince Calandra|Ron Hauge|Joe Murray|Mr. Lawrence|Dan Povenmire|Stephen Hillenburg|Joe D. Suggs|

Episode.Overview: Ed has a nervous breakdown right before a big proposal is due. Bev writes the proposal and then makes an Ed costume that Heffer and Filburt wear to give the speech.

Episode.Overview: Rocko has to have his appendix removed. Rocko hallucinates and makes friends with Pinky, his appendix.

Episode.Overview:

Episode.Overview: Rocko is erroneously going to be deported, so Filburt marries him in order for Rocko to stay in the country.

Episode.Overview: Heffer becomes a security guard and finds it isn't all he expected it to be, in fact, it's quite scary.

Episode.Overview: Ed Bighead will do anything to win the championship trophy. He commissions Rocko, Heffer, and Filburt to play against his woman's auxiliary team.

While exploring Rocko's old home, Filburt's sons, in the future now grown up, find a banana in the fridge. They go to their father, now aged, to explain the story behind the banana in the fridge. In flashbacks, we learn that Conglom-O had put Ed Bighead in charge of a experiment monkey. Rocko and Heffer found out, and tried to save the chimp.
